couldn't have said it better myself Tim :)

--- On Thu, 12/16/10, Tim Woolw=
orth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:


From: Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@gmai=
l.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ghost Boxes in Action
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
.com
Date: Thursday, December 16, 2010, 8:34 PM


=C2=A0 




Ursula,

I ag=
ree completely. For a hack, I have yet to find one that works better and I =
have tried several. =C2=A0It's cheap and sounds good and the popcorn isn't =
too distracting. =C2=A0This is the fallback hack.=C2=A0


On an investigati=
on, I usually try to use one of the linear boxes I have (a Minibox Plus, a =
Joe's Box, and a Franks) for the first session. =C2=A0If we do subsequent s=
essions, it is usually on a hack because everyone in the group is used to t=
he hack sounds whereas the linear boxes require an ear that uses them more =
frequently for real time conversation. =C2=A0Several people in my group use=
 GB's (5 total), but I am the only won with linear boxes. =C2=A0So even tho=
ugh we access to (arguably) better boxes for GBC, in a group situation the =
other investigators (with a few exceptions) prefer the step sweep sound of =
the 125 because its what they know.




Tim





On Thu, Dec 16, 2010 at 8:=
57 PM, Ursula Kalin <kalinu@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 







I'm so g=
lad I have that hack back..its one if everything fails you can pull him out=
 :)

--- On Thu, 12/16/10, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:


F=
rom: Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Ghost Boxes i=
n Action [3 Attachments]
To: RTSC@yahoogroups.com, EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
=
Cc: inside_the_box_rtsc_ghost_box_research@yahoogroups.com
Date: Thursday, =
December 16, 2010, 6:15 PM





=C2=A0 

Hi guys.

As some of you know, I w=
ork with the inimitable Stacey Jones in a
ghost hunting group called Centra=
l New York Ghost Hunters. We have a
TV show that plays throughout Central N=
Y (accessible to over 1.5
million viewers total) called CNY Spirits.

In th=
is episode, which has been uploaded to youtube, you can see the
Minibox Plu=
s on an investigation. It was used in tandem with a poker
game and garnered=
 some amazing results. The Minibox was used in part
2, and everyones favori=
te shack hack was used in part 3. To my
knowledge, this is the first time a=
 Minibox has been used on
television. You will have to ignore what Stacey s=
ays about the
Minibox because she was dead wrong on most of her facts. I wi=
sh that
the producer had interviewed me so I could have explained it a hell=
uva
lot better.

If you are wondering, I am the goofy looking guy with the =
pony tail and tattoos.

You can check out pt 1 here:

http://www.youtube.co=
m/watch?v=3Danxfj8Dlrus&feature=3Drelated

This episode was a followup inve=
stigation to a prior one done about 6
weeks earlier. This earlier investiga=
tion yielded some amazing EVP's
and flashlight responses. YOu can view pt 1=
 here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DEy6uHks4aj4&feature=3Drelated

The=
se are some of the clips from that session.

The clip about "pissing me off=
" has become pretty famous because
Stacey uses it when she lectures at conf=
erences. It is very
intriguing because it is her voice coming through the H=
ack while she
is sitting at the table. I have discussed this clip with a fe=
w of
you, and here it is a lot cleaner than in the video.

The rest of the =
clips are from the poker session that were not in the
video. On the "Holdin=
g a Five" clip, Mike actually had a pair of
fives in his hand.

Tim







=
